title: Canvas Info shows huge size when using Chrome Debugger and using Device Emulation
body:
### Description

Creating a simple app in Blazor that renders the clock-example works great, however, when I run device emulation (any device), it alters the size of the the Viewport, and when I attempt to calculate positioning, from e.Info.Size, it shows as a massive size.  

When I first start the test app, without emulation, the width is 300 and the height is 150... but when press <F12> and go into developer tools, and try any of the built-in device emulators, the result is as per screen shot below with massive dimensions.

![image](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/assets/1290937/34baab14-c697-4a99-bb9a-2a5d82bd967d)

That same appears to be true when I attempt to view the same page on any mobile device. It seems to exhibit the same behavior.

comments.author: mattleibow
comments.body:
I think this is because you have no bounds set so the canvas is trying to resize to not be blurry.

Make sure you have some restrictions on the size - either px or % - on the STYLE:

```razor
<SKGLView
    OnPaintSurface="OnPaintSurface"
    style="width:100%; height:100%;" />
```

See more info: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Canvas_API/Tutorial/Optimizing_canvas#scaling_for_high_resolution_displays
